intro: Comastoma, commonly known as the "white bellflower," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. These plants are characterized by their bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Comastoma species are typically found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats. They are perennial herbaceous plants with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The genus includes several species, such as Comastoma umbellatum, which is native to eastern North America.
